Display a dialog with choices offered as buttons.

Args: - message (str): Message to be displayed in the terminal. - choices (list): A list of tuples for the button options.

Args: - message (str): Message to be displayed in the terminal. - choices (list): A list of tuples for the checkbox options.

ask(message: str = None)[source]¶

Prompt for user input in the terminal.

Args: - message (str): Message to be displayed in the terminal.

choice(message: str = None, choices: list = None)[source]¶

Prompts the user to select from a list of choices.

Args:

message (str): The message to display to the user. choices (list): A list of options for the user to choose from.

Returns:

str: The user’s selected choice.

confirm(message: str = None)[source]¶

Prompts the user for a yes/no confirmation.

Args:

message (str): The message to display to the user.

Returns:

bool: True if the user confirms, False otherwise.

class hammadpy.interactions.messages.TextStyles[source]¶

Bases: object

Simple text styles for terminal output.

Args: - message (str): Message to be displayed in the terminal.

box(message, title=None)[source]¶

Creates a message box with the provided message.

Args:

message (str): The message to display in the box. title (str, optional): The title of the box.

say(message: str, color: str, bg=None, style=None)[source]¶

Prints a styled message to the terminal.

Args:

message (str): The message to print. color (str): Text color (e.g., ‘red’, ‘blue’). bg (str, optional): Background color. style (str, optional): Text style (e.g., ‘bold’, ‘underline’).
